alert.note: Alert for Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN NASSAU... NORTHEASTERN BRADFORD...SOUTHEASTERN BAKER...NORTHWESTERN CLAY... WESTERN DUVAL AND SOUTH CENTRAL CHARLTON COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Cecil Field, or 11 miles northwest of Orange Park, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Middleburg, Cecil Field, Maxville, St. George, Ratliff, Oakleaf Plantation, Bryceville, Nassau Village-Ratliff, Baldwin, and Asbury Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
